Title: Linux Audit: Buffer overflow
Synopsis:
A buffer overflow vulnerability in Linux Audit may allow local attackers to
    execute arbitrary code.

Background.Text: Linux Audit is a set of userspace utilities for storing and processing auditing records.

Description.Text: A stack-based buffer overflow has been reported in the audit_log_user_command() function in the file lib/audit_logging.c when processing overly long arguments.

Impact.Text: A local attacker could execute a specially crafted command on the host running Linux Audit, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Linux Audit.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All Linux Audit users should upgrade to the latest version:
